instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: 2015 MacBook Pro SSD not recognized
threads.message:
I have this old Samsung SSD (MZ-JPV2560), originally from a 2015 MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, that is not recognized in Disk Utility and seems dead. In order to revive it, I'd like to try power cycling it, which can sometimes restore seemingly dead SSDs to factory settings. A tutorial is found here: [URL]https://dfarq.homeip.net/fix-dead-ssd/[/URL]

[ATTACH type="full" width="351px"]60819[/ATTACH]

The recommendation is to unplug the SATA data cable from the SSD and let it sit for 30 minutes being only connected to power. Obviously I cannot unplug anything on this MacBook SSD, but I could cover up most pins with kapton tape before inserting. Which pins are essential for powering the SSD? Would you suggest leaving only a ground pin and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> open? Or include the <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_SSD_FLT</SIGNAL> pins? Do I need <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: 2015 MacBook Pro SSD not recognized
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>3V3_S0SW_SSD</SIGNAL> is the main power rail for SSD.
You should keep it on, as <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> too.
Never tried that method, so no idea if this help in your case...

threads.title: 2015 MacBook Pro SSD not recognized
threads.message: Thanks. It didn't do anything. Was worth a try.
